00163 enum srObjectID
00164 {
00165         OID_Freed = -1,         
00169         OID_Invalid = 0,        
00170         /* The 0xCDAB is a debug aid. It helps us find object IDs in memory
00171          * dumps (on X86, this is ABCD in the dump ;)
00172          * If you are on an embedded device and you would like to save space
00173          * make them 1 byte only.
00174          */
00175         OIDsbFram = 0xCDAB0001,
00176         OIDsbChan = 0xCDAB0002,
00177         OIDsbMesg = 0xCDAB0003,
00178         OIDsbSess = 0xCDAB0004,
00179         OIDsbSock = 0xCDAB0005,
00180         OIDsbProf = 0xCDAB0006,
00181         OIDsrAPI  = 0xCDAB0007,
00182         OIDsrSLMG = 0xCDAB0008,
00183         OIDsbNVTR = 0xCDAB0009,
00184         OIDsbNVTE = 0xCDAB000A,
00185         OIDsbStrB = 0xCDAB000B,
00186         OIDsbLstn = 0xCDAB000C
00187 };
00188 typedef enum srObjectID srObjID;
